title: Mobile Microlearning Design to Improve Learning Transfer in Online Continuing Professional Development (CPD)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital device utilization skills and advanced expertise in the relevant job field
context.additional_context: A short-term course for large-scale learners in a smartphone-based, limited-technology environment, focusing on strengthening job-specific language skills.

learning_goals: Learners select personalized learning paths based on Self-Determination Theory (SDT) in a mobile environment, maintaining educational engagement motivation at 80% or higher.
Learners apply knowledge to practical tasks by completing five or more reflective activities (quizzes, case analyses, etc.) using the Practical Inquiry Model (PIM).
Learners interact with peer experts three or more times via a mobile community to share solutions for language-related job challenges.
Within two weeks after the course, learners apply acquired knowledge to their actual work environment at least twice and report outcomes.

resources: Mobile Community Tool with Real-Time Chat Functionality
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
